detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: EOSC 114 is a hybrid, asynchronous course for all students.  All course content is available directly on the course website or through links to outside resources. There is no textbook for this course. All Quizzes and Assignments are open over a set number of days for students to complete when it fits best within their own schedule. These are then submitted online, through the Course Website. There are no lectures to attend or video lectures to follow. The only time students need to attend a session in-person is for the written final exam. The final exam will be written during the UBC exam period, at a time and date arranged by UBC Exam Services. All students will attend the final exam in-person in a UBC classroom.

instances.text: EOSC_V 116-99A - Mesozoic Earth: Time of the Dinosaurs.

There is no textbook for this course. All Quizzes and Assignments are open over a set number of days for students to complete when it fits best within their own schedule. These are then submitted online, through the Course Website. There are no lectures to attend or video lectures to follow. The only time students need to attend a session in-person is for the written final exam. The final exam will be written during the UBC exam period, at a time and date arranged by UBC Exam Services. instances.text: EXCH_V 101-001 - Canadian University Study Abroad Program (CUSAP) Exchange
FIPR_V 101-001 - Introduction to the History of Film Production

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding waitlist section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

instances.text: FIPR_V 133-001 - Introduction to Film and Media Production

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This section is restricted to students in UBC's Bachelor of Media Studies (BMS) Program.

instances.text: FNEL_V 101-A_001 - Introduction to a Salish Language I (A)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course is an introduction to the Musqueam Central Coast Salish language: http://fnel.arts.ubc.ca/undergraduate/fnel-courses/. Please note that all course materials will be provided in class. Students will be charged a $70.00 fee to cover production costs for all course materials. The location of the class is on the Musqueam Reserve at the Musqueam Community Center, 6735 Salish Drive, Vancouver, B.C. For further information, contact cis.program@ubc.ca. Students will need to register on the waitlist and we will notify students that are accepted into the class. Please note that registering on the waitlist does not guarantee that students will get into the course.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This section is for undergraduate students only. Interested graduate students should consult https://fnel.arts.ubc.ca/undergraduate/courses/ for more information.

instances.text: FNH_V 160-101 - Integrated Physiology for Human Nutrition I

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If you meet the requirements for the course/waitlist but are not able to self-register, please fill out this 2024 Winter Session Registration Request for LFS Courses form. An LFS Academic Advisor will assess your eligibility for registration and you will be notified accordingly.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Credits will be granted for only one of FNIS 100, FNSP 100, or FNSP 200.  This course is intended for undergraduate students only. If you are a graduate student, please visit: http://fnis.arts.ubc.ca/graduate-courses/. If this course is full or blocked, please register on the waitlist and you may be moved into the course section if a seat opens up.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is hybrid. Students are expected to meet with the instructor synchronously for the days and times as indicated (Mondays: Online and asynchronous; Wednesdays & Fridays: In-person and synchronous) 

Before registering the course, please complete French Language Questionnaire to determine which course level to start: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate/advising/placement-in-language-courses/french-language-placement-guidelines/ 

If you have experience of French 12, or French Immersion, you are not allowed to stay in FREN 101.  

View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren101/ 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Before registering the course, please complete French Language Questionnaire to determine which course level to start: https://fhis.air.arts.ubc.ca/french-placement-questionnaire-tool/  

If you have experience of French 11, French 12, or French Immersion, you are not allowed to stay in FREN 101.  

View full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/fren101/  

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
